items.summary: While the surging gold price has been a surprise, the driving forces behind it are not. Investors are losing faith in the United States and its role as the standard-bearer for global capitalism.

items.title: Mandurah teacher who had student's baby pleads guilty to sexual abuse
items.summary: A WA teacher pleads guilty to sexually abusing a boy who police say fathered her baby.

items.title: Sydney men granted bail after alleged attempt to smuggle 65 kilograms of heroin into Australia
items.summary: Police allege officers found an estimated 65 kilograms of white powder, which returned a positive result for heroin.

items.title: Sink or Swim | Michael Klim
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Should you leave the air con on for your pets?
items.summary: Do you wonder what your pet gets up to at home when you're not there? With temperatures on the rise, we asked three experts about keeping them cool in the heat.

items.title: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins calls to boycott men's World Cup games in US
items.summary: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of men's World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration.

items.title: Japan says goodbye to its last pandas as relations with Beijing deteriorate
items.summary: The departure of the last pandas from Japan demonstrates a significant crisis in North-East Asian politics that has no resolution on the horizon.

items.title: The school holidays are over, how's your bedtime routine looking?
items.summary: Has your bedtime routine gone out the window over the school holidays? We've got you covered with these expert tips.

items.title: Maddison and Teagan Levi opt out of NRLW switch to re-sign with Rugby Australia on two-year deal
items.summary: Maddison and Teagan Levi have turned down a potential switch to the NRLW and re-signed with Rugby Australia in an effort to claim rugby sevens gold at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.

items.title: Melbourne boy Danny, 12, missing from Venus Bay beach presumed dead
items.summary: A search for a 12-year-old boy missing at a South Gippsland beach has shifted to a recovery operation.

items.title: Man charged with making explosives after Perth Invasion Day incident
items.summary: A 31-year-old man is charged with making explosives in suspicious circumstances after a device was allegedly thrown into a crowd of hundreds of people attending an Invasion Day rally in central Perth yesterday.

items.title: Kanye West takes out Wall Street Journal ad to apologise for antisemitism
items.summary: Ye, the artist formerly known as Kanye West, has taken out a full-page ad in the Wall Street Journal to apologise for past behaviour, saying he had an undiagnosed brain injury and bipolar disorder.

items.title: Rescue dog used in central Queensland koala monitoring program
items.summary: This scruffy pup has gone from the pound to being part of a scat detection dog team, helping save endangered koalas.

items.title: How the Perth Scorchers sit alone as Australia's greatest Big Bash League franchise
items.summary: Six titles in 15 seasons is an extraordinary record, but what is the secret of the Perth Scorchers' incredible success?

items.title: Another quarterfinal exit for de Minaur as Alcaraz wins in straight sets
items.summary: Alex de Minaur has been knocked out of the quarterfinals by world number one Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets.

items.title: Race to save 'zombie tree' as scientists fight to stop living species from dying out
items.summary: Scientists and nursery workers race to save a newly identified tree species in Queensland branded "living dead", after a fungal disease stopped it from growing or reproducing in the wild.

items.title: Overland Telegraph Line documentary features First Nations accounts of violence
items.summary: Aboriginal filmmaker Kieran Satour's documentary tells of murders and massacres by settlers and First Nations people during construction of the Overland Telegraph Line.

items.title: Emergency warnings for Victorian fires, as heatwave sends temperatures soaring — as it happened
items.summary: A record-breaking heatwave is impacting south-east Australia, with temperature records tumbling in parts of Victoria and South Australia.

items.title: SA divers have close encounter with great white shark, as local sightings grow
items.summary: The sighting comes amid a spate of white shark reports in SA's south east, and after a tragic month of incidents in NSW.

items.title: Sir Donald Bradman's baggy green fetches record price at auction
items.summary: A baggy green cap worn by Don Bradman in the 1947-48 series against India has been sold for $460,000 at auction.

items.title: Emergency feed arrives for remote WA pastoralists amid worst drought in decades
items.summary: Volunteer truck drivers and farmers rally to deliver tonnes of hay, providing relief for livestock and pastoralists in a remote part of Western Australia quietly struggling with drought.

items.title: Trump suggests he may rein in Minnesota ICE operation amid public outrage
items.summary: The Trump administration indicates it could rein in its Minnesota immigration crackdown as public outrage intensifies after a federal agent killed a protester.

items.title: Noosa houseboats forced off river as new maritime rules take effect
items.summary: A David and Goliath battle is playing out on the multi-million-dollar shores of the Noosa River, where dozens of houseboat residents say they are being forced out and potentially into financial ruin.

items.title: Kumanjayi Dempsey's family speak out after 'devastating' Tennant Creek death in custody
items.summary: The family of a woman who recently died inside an NT police watch house is calling for answers, asking why she wasn't checked by medical staff for nearly two days, and demanding immediate action to improve conditions.

items.title: Woman discovers Holocaust descendants through DNA testing
items.summary: Adriana Turk grew up believing there were no survivors on her Jewish father's side after World War II, but a DNA test showed that was not the case.

items.title: Australian share market rallies to three-month high — as it happened
items.summary: The ASX 200 closed at levels last seen in late October, trading higher as gold and silver surge in price. See how the day unfolded plus insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

items.title: Ley backer insists leadership speculation 'all sound and fury signifying nothing' — as it happened
items.summary: A backer of Sussan Ley has taken aim at the fevered speculation about a looming Liberal leadership challenge, dismissing it as "sound and fury signifying nothing".

items.title: Getting ready for the first day of school looks very different across Australia
items.summary: Families across the country, from the coast to the outback, are gearing up to return to school after a long, hot summer.

items.title: A peaceful gathering in Perth's CBD turns to chaos in a matter of seconds. So what really happened?
items.summary: Premier Roger Cook says the way an orderly protest was targeted "runs against the very heart of what it means to be Australian". So what really happened in Perth's CBD on Australia Day?

items.title: Hellyer lead and zinc mine's previous operator has gone into liquidation
items.summary: Hellyer Metals, which until recently operated Tasmania's Hellyer lead and zinc mine, has gone into liquidation. But the company says the mine is unaffected because it is now operated by a different company.

items.title: Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo's fashion designs bring punk, play and power to new exhibition at the NGV
items.summary: The revolutionary work of fashion designers Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo is celebrated with style, surprise and punk flair in this new exhibition.

items.title: Maddison Inglis exits Australian Open after loss to Iga Świątek in fourth round
items.summary: Maddison Inglis did not expect to reach the Australian Open fourth round, while she reveals the unusual items she wants to buy with her prize money.

items.title: Darderi's tantrum against Sinner, and Ostapenko nails opponent in the face — quick hits from the Australian Open
items.summary: Sabalenka and Alcaraz denied fitness tracking devices, Darderi has a tantrum and Siegemund cops a tennis ball to the face. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

items.title: Adelaide swelters through night as 'extreme' fire danger forecast across South Australia
items.summary: Authorities are urging South Australians to be vigilant and "make good choices" as "extreme" fire danger is forecast for the southern half of the state.

items.title: China's aging population is saving its way towards economic stagnation
items.summary: Unlike many Western economies, Chinese households stash away more than 40 per cent of their income. But the pressure to boost local consumption is mounting for Beijing.

items.title: What does the probe into senior military officials in China mean for Xi Jinping?
items.summary: Another two senior generals are under investigation for alleged corruption in China and that has big consequences for President Xi Jinping.

items.summary: Firefighters warn a wind change is likely to worsen Otways blaze, while temperature records tumble across the state.

items.title: Russia, Ukraine and US plan further trilateral talks on ending war
items.summary: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says discussions between envoys from Ukraine, Russia and the US in Abu Dhabi last week aimed at ending Moscow's invasion have left some political issues unresolved.

items.title: Donald Trump sends 'border tsar' Tom Homan to Minnesota after shooting of nurse Alex Pretti
items.summary: An American citizen, Alex Pretti, was shot by federal agents during a continuing Trump administration immigration crackdown in the city.

items.title: Benjamin Netanyahu announces discovery of remains of last Israeli hostage in Gaza, Ran Gvili
items.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the remains of Ran Gvili have been found and identified.

items.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
items.summary: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

items.title: Gunmen open fire at soccer field in central Mexico, killing 11
items.summary: Authorities say gunmen opened fire in the city of Salamanca, killing at least 11 people and wounding 12 at the end of a soccer match.

items.title: Call for memorial to Beaumont children, 60 years after they disappeared
items.summary: Politician Frank Pangallo is calling for a permanent memorial to be installed at an Adelaide beach to acknowledge the disappearance of the Beaumont children in 1966.

items.title: Quick and easy burger recipes for stress-free summer dinners
items.summary: From chargrilled beef patties and beer-battered fish to vegetarian parmigiana and cheeseburger tray bake, we have burgers to suit all tastes and diets.

items.title: Australia Day heat record for Adelaide, as mercury hits 49C in Ceduna
items.summary: As Adelaide sets a new record for its hottest Australia Day, other parts of SA are enduring conditions that are even more sweltering, with the mercury climbing above 49C in Ceduna.

items.title: Traditional owners heartbroken over decision to cull K'gari dingoes involved in Piper James's death
items.summary: The Queensland government euthanises six dingoes involved in Piper James's death on K'gari, and is expected to cull more in the coming days.

items.title: Animated movie Imagine invited 150 Indigenous kids to collaborate with stars like Taika Waititi

items.title: Australian of the Year Katherine Bennell-Pegg reflects on space, STEM and the launch pad
items.summary: The 2026 Australian of the Year — astronaut and space engineer Katherine Bennell-Pegg — is a strong advocate for STEM education, but fears too much talent is being left on the "launch pad".

items.title: Police appeal for information after 54-year-old woman assaulted in Sale home invasion
items.summary: Wellington Crime Investigation detectives turn to the public for help as they continue to investigate a 2025 home invasion where they allege three men broke in and assaulted a woman.

items.title: 'Dog in driver's seat' of ute on Tasmanian beach sparks call for witnesses
items.summary: Reports of a "dog in the driver's seat" of a ute driving on a Tasmanian beach have prompted police to ask for witnesses to come forward.

items.title: Gold's record run rolls on with prices surging past $US5,000 as investors seek safety
items.summary: Gold surges to a record high above $US5,000 an ounce, extending a historic rally as investors pile into the safe-haven asset amid rising geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Australia Day 2026 marked by citizenship ceremonies, traditional dances, fun runs and heatwave conditions
items.summary: Communities across the country are marking Australia Day with citizenship ceremonies, traditional dances, smoking ceremonies and fun runs, as the prime minister calls for "unity not division" during a speech in Canberra.

items.title: Potential explosive device thrown into crowd at Perth Invasion Day rally, police say
items.summary: Police say they are investigating whether a device thrown into an Invasion Day rally crowd in Perth contained explosives, in addition to ball bearings and screws found inside.

items.title: US citizens are becoming collateral damage in Donald Trump's quest to deport immigrants
items.summary: Minneapolis has become the flashpoint of an aggressive immigration enforcement operation ordered by the Trump administration and pitched as a campaign against undocumented criminals.

items.title: What is life like in Delhi, one of the world's most polluted cities?
items.summary: Poor air quality in Delhi has impacted nearly all aspects of life with residents saying they have lost many of the "simple joys" such as opening a window or going for a walk outside.

items.title: Two men dead after drowning in Never Never River north of Bellingen
items.summary: Two men have drowned and another remains in a stable condition in hospital after a mishap in a river on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

items.title: Anthony is Boddington's 'underground' carer for orphaned joeys despite the licensing hurdles

items.title: Videos of Minneapolis shooting appear to contradict Trump administration's claims
items.summary: Multiple videos emerge of nurse Alex Pretti being pepper-sprayed, wrestled to the ground and then shot. The Trump administration says Mr Pretti was an armed man provoking violence.

items.title: More than 1,100 properties under evacuation warnings for Otways fire before extreme weather hits on Tuesday
items.summary: Residents from more than 1,100 properties near Victoria's Otways bushfire have been asked to evacuate before sunset ahead of extreme fire conditions on Tuesday.

items.title: National Film and Sound Archive's restoration of Mount Gambier edition of Life in Australia film given new life
items.summary: The National Film and Sound Archive has released 4K restorations of the 1960s film series Life in Australia, commissioned by the Department of Immigration to attract new migrants to regional Australia.

items.title: Brisbane temperatures tops 35 degrees as Cairns and Townsville face soaking rain
items.summary: South-east Queensland is sweating through its hottest Australia Day so far this century, with Brisbane recording its highest maximum temperature since 1998.

items.title: How the Atlas Network is shaping your life, even if you've never heard of it
items.summary: A constant battle of ideas reshapes the world we live in, and few groups have been more successful in winning the war than the little-known Atlas Network.
